reasoning: Chronic headache disorder measured by prevalence, not incidence. Global prevalence approximately 2-2.5% (2,200 per 100k) based on epidemiological studies. Chronic form represents subset of all tension-type headaches.
source: Stovner LJ et al. (2007). The global burden of headache: a documentation of headache prevalence and disability worldwide. Cephalalgia. 27(3):193-210
